Malte,
 
A way I can think of to clean up after a whole run (and set up before one
starts, for that matter), is to attach a listener of your own devising to a
JUnitCore and use it to run the tests. This doesn't let you integrate with
existing tools, like running in Eclipse, however.
 
Here's a bit of code that illustrates this idea:
 
public static void main(String[] args) {
    Class<?>[] classes= new Class<?>[0]; // insert your classes here
    JUnitCore core= new JUnitCore();
    core.addListener(new RunListener() {
        @Override
        public void testRunFinished(Result result) throws Exception {
            // cleanUpEverything();
        }
    });
    Result result= core.run(classes);
    System.out.println(result);
}
 
Regards,
 
Kent

Subject: [junit] cleaning up after a whole test suite (junit4)



Hi there,

is there a way to run cleanup code after all test are run?
I sometimes have some setup that I want done once before any test is
run. This is easy with a lazy init.
But how do I tear it down again?

In JUnit 3 there was a possibility to wrap a suite.
How is this done in JUnit 4?

Greetings,
Malte
